models.name: econ_political_forum_categories
models.description: Categories for econPoliticalForum. Represents the canonical classification of threads and content. Categories drive visibility rules (public, moderated, restricted), may require verification for posting, and are referenced by threads and moderation workflows. Contains business identifiers (code, slug), display metadata, and flags used by content gating and moderator routing.

plainFields.name: code
plainFields.description: Optional short business code for the category (e.g., 'fiscal', 'trade'). Unique when present.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Human-visible category name (for display in UI and navigation).

plainFields.name: slug
plainFields.description: URL-friendly unique slug for the category (used for routing and lookups).

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Longer textual description explaining the purpose and scope of the category.

plainFields.name: is_moderated
plainFields.description: Whether new posts in this category require moderator approval before public publishing.

plainFields.name: requires_verification
plainFields.description: If true, posting in this category requires a verified account (email verified or other verification).

plainFields.name: order
plainFields.description: Display order hint for UI lists; lower values are shown earlier.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp; null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_site_settings
models.description: Site-level configuration settings for econPoliticalForum. Key/value pairs used by application code and business logic to control runtime behavior, feature gating defaults, moderation thresholds, and environment-specific overrides. Intended to be small, read-mostly, and administrable via an admin UI. Keys must be unique.

plainFields.name: key
plainFields.description: Unique configuration key (namespace.form). Example: 'moderation.report_threshold'.

plainFields.name: value
plainFields.description: Configuration value stored as string. Typed interpretation handled by application logic (boolean/int/json as needed).

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description and intent of the setting for administrators.

plainFields.name: environment
plainFields.description: Optional environment tag (e.g., 'production', 'staging') to scope overrides.

plainFields.name: is_public
plainFields.description: Whether this setting is visible to non-admin clients/UI (for example for feature exposure).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp; null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_feature_flags
models.description: Runtime feature flags controlling experimental features, gradual rollouts, and admin toggles. This table is read-mostly and is consulted at runtime to enable/disable features per key. Includes rollout percentage for progressive exposure and an administrable description. Keys are unique.

plainFields.name: key
plainFields.description: Unique feature flag key (e.g., 'new_search_ui').

plainFields.name: enabled
plainFields.description: Whether the feature is currently enabled globally.

plainFields.name: rollout_percentage
plainFields.description: Optional rollout percentage (0-100) used for gradual exposure to a subset of users; null indicates not used.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description explaining the feature and purpose.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp; null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_guest
models.description: Lightweight guest identity record for unauthenticated or ephemeral visitors. Guests can browse and may file reports but cannot create persistent content. Stored to support anonymous or limited interactions and moderation traceability. Linked content references should point to specific actor tables when applicable. This table is primarily for tracking ephemeral identities and basic metadata.

plainFields.name: nickname
plainFields.description: Optional display nickname provided by the guest for ephemeral identification in a session. Not verified.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: User-agent string captured at first interaction for basic device/context information.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for the guest record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp. Null if active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_registereduser
models.description: Primary persistent registered user account. Contains authentication and profile fields used throughout the platform. Supports email/password or external auth (password_hash nullable). Includes verification and lockout fields to support email verification, account lockout policies, and basic security telemetry. Uniqueness enforced on username and email.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description: Unique account username used for login and display (normalized).

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Verified email address for account recovery and notifications.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Password hash for local authentication. Nullable for accounts created via external OAuth providers.

plainFields.name: display_name
plainFields.description: Optional display name shown publicly; may differ from username.

plainFields.name: bio
plainFields.description: Optional short biography or profile description.

plainFields.name: avatar_uri
plainFields.description: URI to user's avatar image (may be proxied via CDN).

plainFields.name: is_banned
plainFields.description: Flag indicating whether the account is currently banned.

plainFields.name: banned_until
plainFields.description: Optional suspension expiry timestamp when temporarily banned.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Whether the account's email has been verified (true) or not (false).

plainFields.name: verified_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the account's email was verified; null if not verified.

plainFields.name: failed_login_attempts
plainFields.description: Rolling counter of recent failed login attempts used to enforce temporary lockouts.

plainFields.name: locked_until
plainFields.description: If present, authentication is blocked until this timestamp as part of lockout policy.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Most recent successful login timestamp for security analytics.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Account creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last profile update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp for account deletion requests or anonymization.

models.name: econ_political_forum_moderator
models.description: Moderator role record linking back to a registered user. Stores moderator-specific metadata such as assignment, active status, and moderation scope. The registereduser_id is unique enforcing a 1:1 relationship between a moderator record and the registered user identity.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Linked registered user identity. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether the moderator is active and assigned to triage duties.

plainFields.name: assigned_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when moderator privileges were granted or assigned.

plainFields.name: scope_notes
plainFields.description: Optional notes describing moderator scope or jurisdiction (e.g., categories assigned).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Moderator record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for moderator metadata.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp if moderator privileges are revoked and record retained for audit.

models.name: econ_political_forum_administrator
models.description: Administrator role record linking to a registered user. Stores admin-specific metadata and flags for global privileges. This enforces a 1:1 mapping to a registered user to centralize identity while separating admin attributes and auditability.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Linked registered user identity. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

plainFields.name: is_super
plainFields.description: Flag indicating whether the administrator has full (super) privileges.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Optional administrative notes for audit or delegation purposes.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Administrator record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for admin metadata.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp used when admin privileges are revoked while preserving audit trail.

models.name: econ_political_forum_sessions
models.description: Session records for registered users. Stores session tokens, expiration, client metadata, and last activity to enable session revocation and rotation. This is a subsidiary table managed through the registered user lifecycle APIs and is not a primary business entity by itself.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Owning registered user. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

plainFields.name: session_token
plainFields.description: Opaque session token or token identifier used for session validation. Should be unique per active session.

plainFields.name: refresh_token_hash
plainFields.description: Hash of refresh token for rotation and verification; storing hash improves security.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address observed at session creation for risk analysis and security logs.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: User agent string captured at session creation.

plainFields.name: last_active_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the last observed activity for the session.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Session expiry timestamp.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Session creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for session record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp for revoked sessions retained for audit.

models.name: econ_political_forum_password_resets
models.description: Password reset requests for registered users. Stores a single-use reset token (or its hash), expiry, usage flag, and timestamps. This is a subsidiary table used by account recovery flows and is managed through registered user lifecycle operations.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Target registered user for the password reset request. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

plainFields.name: reset_token_hash
plainFields.description: Hash of the single-use reset token. Storing a hash avoids storing plaintext tokens.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Expiry timestamp for the reset token.

plainFields.name: used
plainFields.description: Flag indicating whether the reset token has been consumed.

plainFields.name: used_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the token was consumed, if applicable.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp for the password reset request.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp for expired or revoked reset requests kept for audit.

models.name: econ_political_forum_threads
models.description: Discussion threads (top-level topics). Canonical thread metadata only — no pre-calculated aggregates. Refer to category ({@link econ_political_forum_categories.id}) and author ({@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}). Temporal fields included for audit and soft-delete. Counters (view_count, post_count) removed per normalization rules; use materialized views (mv_*) for aggregates.

foreignFields.name: category_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged category. {@link econ_political_forum_categories.id}.

foreignFields.name: author_id
foreignFields.description: Authoring registered user. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Thread title used for listing and search.

plainFields.name: slug
plainFields.description: URL-friendly identifier for the thread (unique).

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Thread lifecycle status (e.g., 'open','closed','pinned').

plainFields.name: pinned
plainFields.description: Whether the thread is pinned for prominent display.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp; null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_posts
models.description: Posts and replies belonging to threads. Canonical post content only (no cached counters or rendered HTML). Parent relation kept for replies. Revision history stored in econ_political_forum_post_revisions (snapshot). Removed derived fields (vote_count, upvote_count, downvote_count, content_html) to comply with normalization rules; move aggregates to materialized views.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged thread. {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}.

foreignFields.name: author_id
foreignFields.description: Authoring registered user. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

foreignFields.name: parent_id
foreignFields.description: Optional parent post for replies. {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Raw post content (plaintext or sanitized markdown).

plainFields.name: is_edited
plainFields.description: Flag indicating whether the post was edited after creation.

plainFields.name: edited_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the latest edit; null if never edited.

plainFields.name: is_hidden
plainFields.description: Moderator hide flag; when true the post is not shown in public listings.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp; null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_post_revisions
models.description: Append-only revision history for posts. Each revision captures the full post content at a point in time, the editor (if different from author), and a created_at timestamp. This table is snapshot-like and intended for audit/history and moderator review.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Referenced post. {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}.

foreignFields.name: editor_id
foreignFields.description: Editor (registered user) who made the revision, if applicable. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Full post content snapshot at the time of revision.

plainFields.name: note
plainFields.description: Optional short editor note describing the change.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Revision timestamp (when the snapshot was recorded).

models.name: econ_political_forum_tags
models.description: Normalized tag catalog used for discovery and search across the econPoliticalForum. Each tag is a primary, independently managed entity. Tags are referenced by threads through the join table {@link econ_political_forum_thread_tags}. Includes temporal fields for auditing and soft-delete support.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Human-readable tag name. Examples: 'fiscal-policy', 'inflation'. Normalized and unique.

plainFields.name: slug
plainFields.description: URL-safe lower-case slug for the tag. Unique and indexed for fast lookup.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Optional longer description of the tag's purpose or scope.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp (UTC).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp (UTC).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp. Null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_thread_tags
models.description: Join table mapping threads to tags. Renamed foreign key field to tag_id for naming consistency and added index optimized for tag->threads lookups. Preserves UUID primary key, created_at and soft-delete fields for audit. References: {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}, {@link econ_political_forum_tags.id}.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged thread. {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}.

foreignFields.name: tag_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged tag. {@link econ_political_forum_tags.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the tag was attached to the thread.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp for the join. Null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_votes
models.description: User votes on posts. One vote per user per post is enforced via a composite unique constraint. Stores vote value (application-enforced domain: 1 = upvote, -1 = downvote), timestamps, and soft-delete to support audit and rollback. References {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id} and {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Owning registered user's {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Target post's {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}.

plainFields.name: value
plainFields.description: Vote value. Business domain: 1 = upvote, -1 = downvote. Application should validate allowed values; consider DB CHECK or string enum if preferred.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp for the vote record.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update time for the vote record (used when vote is changed).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp; null when active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_bookmarks
models.description: User bookmarks (saved posts). Enforces one bookmark per user per post via composite unique constraint. Soft-delete used to allow unbookmark while preserving an audit trail. References {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id} and {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Owning registered user's {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Bookmarked post's {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Bookmark creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update time for the bookmark (if metadata changes).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp; null when bookmark is active.

models.name: econ_political_forum_thread_follows
models.description: Tracks thread subscriptions (follows) by users for notification and feed generation. Enforces one follow per user per thread. Includes optional muted_until for temporary notification suppression. References {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id} and {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Owning registered user's {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Followed thread's {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the follow was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update time for the follow (e.g., mute toggles).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp; null when follow is active.

plainFields.name: muted_until
plainFields.description: Optional timestamp until which notifications for this follow are muted.

models.name: econ_political_forum_reports
models.description: Structured user reports of potentially violating content (post or thread). Captures reporter identity (when available), selected reason code, optional reporter details, linkage to target content (post or thread), current processing status, moderation_case association, and SLA timestamps for triage and review. Adjusted to ensure referential integrity and audit preservation: reporter FK uses SET NULL semantics (preserve reports if user removed), removed incorrect generated reverse-array relation, and added composite indexes and GIN index for search. Includes explicit temporal fields and soft-delete for retention. {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id} {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id} {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}

foreignFields.name: reporter_id
foreignFields.description: Reporting user's {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}. Null if reporter requested anonymity or is unauthenticated.

foreignFields.name: reported_post_id
foreignFields.description: Target post's {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}. Nullable if the report targets a thread instead.

foreignFields.name: reported_thread_id
foreignFields.description: Target thread's {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}. Nullable if the report targets a post.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Reviewing moderator's {@link econ_political_forum_moderator.id}. Populated when a moderator triages or acts on the report.

foreignFields.name: moderation_case_id
foreignFields.description: Associated moderation case {@link econ_political_forum_moderation_cases.id} aggregating related reports for admin review.

plainFields.name: reason_code
plainFields.description: Structured reason code selected by the reporter (e.g., 'harassment','doxxing','misinformation','illegal_content','spam','other'). Stored as string for flexibility and clarity.

plainFields.name: reporter_text
plainFields.description: Optional free-text provided by reporter giving additional context (max 2000 chars recommended).

plainFields.name: reporter_anonymous
plainFields.description: Whether the reporter requested anonymity from the content author/public. Moderators retain reporter identity in internal UI when available.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Processing state of the report (e.g., 'pending','triaged','dismissed','action_taken','escalated').

plainFields.name: priority
plainFields.description: Operational priority label for triage (e.g., 'low','normal','high','urgent').

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Report creation timestamp (immutable).

plainFields.name: triaged_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when a moderator first acknowledged or triaged the report.

plainFields.name: reviewed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when a final review/action was recorded for the report.

plainFields.name: resolved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the report was resolved (action taken or dismissed).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp for the report record when removal is required. Use sparingly; legal holds may prevent deletion.

models.name: econ_political_forum_moderation_logs
models.description: Immutable moderation log entries recording actions taken by moderators or system actors. Each entry is append-only and includes actor reference, action type, linked content (post or thread), optional linkage to a moderation case, structured reason codes, and free-text rationale. Designed for legal audit, retention, and chronological reconstruction of moderation decisions. {@\link econ_political_forum_moderator.id} {@\link econ_political_forum_posts.id} {@\link econ_political_forum_threads.id} {@\link econ_political_forum_moderation_cases.id}

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Acting moderator's {@\link econ_political_forum_moderator.id}. Nullable for system or automated actions.

foreignFields.name: target_post_id
foreignFields.description: Target post affected by the action ({@\link econ_political_forum_posts.id}). Nullable if action targets a thread or user record.

foreignFields.name: target_thread_id
foreignFields.description: Target thread affected by the action ({@\link econ_political_forum_threads.id}). Nullable if action targets a post.

foreignFields.name: moderation_case_id
foreignFields.description: Associated moderation case {@\link econ_political_forum_moderation_cases.id} for grouped investigations.

foreignFields.name: acted_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Acting administrator id when an admin performed or finalized the action ({@\link econ_political_forum_administrator.id}). Nullable.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of moderation action (e.g., 'hide','remove','warning','suspend','approve','escalate','merge','flag').

plainFields.name: reason_code
plainFields.description: Structured policy reason code applied by the moderator (maps to policy clauses).

plainFields.name: rationale
plainFields.description: Moderator-provided free-text rationale explaining the action (up to recommended 1000 chars).

plainFields.name: evidence_reference
plainFields.description: Optional URI or reference id pointing to stored evidence bundles or archived snapshots (could be internal object id or URL).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the moderation action was recorded (immutable).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete marker for the log entry (rare; prefer append-only retention).

models.name: econ_political_forum_moderation_cases
models.description: Moderation case entity that aggregates related reports and moderation logs for administrator investigation, escalation, and appeals processing. Contains operational metadata for triage, assignment, legal hold flagging, and case lifecycle timestamps. Cases provide a single coordination point for researchers and admins while preserving immutable moderation_logs for audit.

foreignFields.name: assigned_moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator assigned to manage the case {@link econ_political_forum_moderator.id}. Nullable when unassigned.

foreignFields.name: owner_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator owner or final approver for the case {@link econ_political_forum_administrator.id}. Nullable.

plainFields.name: lead_report_id
plainFields.description: Representative report id that initiated the case {@link econ_political_forum_reports.id}. Stored as uuid rather than a DB-level foreign key to avoid circular dependency.

plainFields.name: case_number
plainFields.description: Human-friendly unique case identifier used in operations and communication (e.g., 'CASE-2025-0001').

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Short case title summarizing the issue for quick identification.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Lifecycle status of the case (e.g., 'open','investigating','closed','on_hold').

plainFields.name: priority
plainFields.description: Operational priority label (e.g., 'low','normal','high','urgent').

plainFields.name: summary
plainFields.description: Concise summary or executive note for the case; suitable for dashboards and quick reviews.

plainFields.name: escalation_reason
plainFields.description: If escalated, the reason for escalation (e.g., 'legal','law_enforcement','coordinated_activity').

plainFields.name: legal_hold
plainFields.description: Whether a legal hold applies to the case and associated evidence; when true archival/deletion operations must be inhibited.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Case creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp for the case.

plainFields.name: closed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the case was closed/resolved.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp for the case record (rare).

models.name: econ_political_forum_notifications
models.description: User-facing notification events. Each record represents a single notification targeted to a registered user (recipient). Notifications are append-only events by business practice with soft-delete support. Records contain a small, flexible JSON payload (stored as string) for extensible delivery payloads (mentions, replies, moderation actions, system messages). Key relations: recipient ({@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}), optional actor ({@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}) who triggered the notification, and optional references to related domain entities (thread, post, moderation_case) stored as UUIDs for cross-component linkage. Optimized for fast per-recipient reads and supports marking notifications as read, delivery timestamps, and light audit fields.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Recipient registered user's {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}.

foreignFields.name: actor_registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Optional actor (triggering user) {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}. Nullable when system-generated.

plainFields.name: type
plainFields.description: Notification type code (e.g., 'mention', 'reply', 'moderation', 'system').

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Short human-readable title for the notification. Optional; used in UI summaries.

plainFields.name: body
plainFields.description: Optional short message body or plain-text excerpt for display in lists.

plainFields.name: payload
plainFields.description: Flexible JSON payload (serialized as string) containing structured delivery data (links to thread/post ids, excerpt, metadata).

plainFields.name: is_read
plainFields.description: Whether the recipient has marked this notification as read.

plainFields.name: delivered_at
plainFields.description: When the notification was delivered to the user (for push/email). Nullable if not yet delivered or for in-app only events.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp. When set, notification is treated as removed from normal listings but retained for audit.

plainFields.name: related_thread_id
plainFields.description: Optional related thread id (referencing {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}) stored as UUID for linkage. Nullable to avoid hard FK to other component in this schema file.

plainFields.name: related_post_id
plainFields.description: Optional related post id (referencing {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}) stored as UUID for linkage.

plainFields.name: related_moderation_case_id
plainFields.description: Optional related moderation case id (referencing {@link econ_political_forum_moderation_cases.id}) stored as UUID for linkage.

models.name: econ_political_forum_notification_preferences
models.description: Per-user notification delivery preferences. One row per registered user controls channel-level toggles (in-app, email, push) and a flexible JSON string for per-notification-type overrides. Designed to be small and infrequently updated; referenced when enqueuing or delivering notifications. Links to registered users via a one-to-one foreign key constraint.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged registered user's {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}. One-to-one relationship enforced with a unique constraint.

plainFields.name: in_app
plainFields.description: Whether in-app notifications are enabled for the user.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Whether email notifications are enabled for the user.

plainFields.name: push
plainFields.description: Whether push notifications are enabled for the user.

plainFields.name: preferences_payload
plainFields.description: Optional JSON-serialized per-type preference overrides (e.g., {"mentions": {"email": false}}) stored as string for portability.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Record creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Record last update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp for preference records.

models.name: econ_political_forum_audit_logs
models.description: Immutable audit log entries capturing system and moderation events for compliance and incident investigation. Each record references acting principals and related objects (post, thread, report, moderation case). Relations intentionally use nullable foreign keys and MUST use SET NULL or RESTRICT on delete to preserve audit history when referenced objects are removed. This model is append-only and classified as a snapshot for retention and legal export workflows.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Acting user's {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}. Nullable for system actions.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Acting moderator's {@link econ_political_forum_moderator.id}. Nullable when action is not by a moderator.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Referenced post {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}. Nullable to preserve audit when posts are removed.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Referenced thread {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}. Nullable to preserve audit when threads are removed.

foreignFields.name: report_id
foreignFields.description: Associated report {@link econ_political_forum_reports.id}. Nullable to preserve audit records independent of report lifecycle.

foreignFields.name: moderation_case_id
foreignFields.description: Associated moderation case {@link econ_political_forum_moderation_cases.id}. Nullable to preserve audit records independent of case lifecycle.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Categorical action type (e.g., 'create', 'edit', 'delete', 'hide', 'warn', 'suspend', 'escalate', 'legal_disclosure').

plainFields.name: target_type
plainFields.description: Type of target object (e.g., 'post','thread','user','report','moderation_case').

plainFields.name: target_identifier
plainFields.description: Canonical identifier of the target as a string for cross-domain queries; nullable when not applicable.

plainFields.name: details
plainFields.description: Free-text or JSON-serialized details of the event (evidence snapshot, moderator rationale, metadata). Keep size reasonable; heavy binary artifacts should be stored externally and referenced by evidence_reference.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the audit entry was recorded (ISO 8601).

plainFields.name: created_by_system
plainFields.description: Whether the entry was generated by an automated system (true) or by a human actor (false).

models.name: econ_political_forum_legal_holds
models.description: Legal hold records that prevent deletion or purging of content subject to legal or investigatory requirements. Holds must persist independently of target object lifecycle; relations use nullable FKs and application/DB logic must prevent purge while holds are active. Classified as subsidiary because holds support enforcement rather than user-facing CRUD.

foreignFields.name: registereduser_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator or legal officer who placed the hold. {@link econ_political_forum_registereduser.id}. Nullable when placed by system/legal process.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: If the hold targets a specific post, reference to {@link econ_political_forum_posts.id}. Nullable when the hold targets a thread or case.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: If the hold targets a thread, reference to {@link econ_political_forum_threads.id}. Nullable when not applicable.

foreignFields.name: moderation_case_id
foreignFields.description: Optional link to a related moderation case {@link econ_political_forum_moderation_cases.id} that motivated the hold.

plainFields.name: hold_reason
plainFields.description: Short human-readable reason for the legal hold (e.g., 'subpoena', 'law enforcement request', 'litigation').

plainFields.name: hold_start
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the hold became effective (ISO 8601).

plainFields.name: hold_end
plainFields.description: Optional timestamp when the hold is scheduled to end; null if indefinite.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether the hold is currently active and prevents purging.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Optional free-text notes or case identifiers for internal use; do not expose sensitive PII in this field without access controls.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the hold record was created.
